name: Chenshu Wu
content: Chenshu Wu - AIoT Research at HKU Chenshu Wu | Âê≥Èô≥Ê≤≠ HKU AIoT (Artificial Intelligence of Things) Lab Assistant Professor, Department of Computer Science Associate Head, Department of Computer Science The University of Hong Kong Office: 315B, Chow Yei Ching Building Email: chenshu [at] cs [dot] hku [dot] hk Home | Biography | Publications | Teaching | Research | Awards News I am actively looking for highly self-motivated PhD students to work on AIoT systems, with potential HKPF and HKU-PS scholarships. If you are interested, please drop me an email. Multiple PhD, postdoc, and RA positions are available. Check out more details here: Prospective Students Are you still using Wi-Fi for the Internet only? You are missing a lot! Check out our recent article "Wi-Fi Can Do More: Towards Ubiquitous Wireless Sensing" on IEEE Communications Standards Magazine! Check out HKU AIoT Lab website for more updates! 2025/10, invited to serve on the TPC of ACM MobiSys 2026. 2025/09, OctoNet accepted to NeurIPS 2025 Datasets and Benchmarks Track! Congrats! 2025/08, received the 2025 IEEE Communications Society Fred W. Ellersick Prize. 2025/05, üî• Check out HotSense @ MobiCom 2025 ‚Äî the first ACM workshop on thermal sensing and computing! 2025/04, one paper from our group accepted to OSDI 2025 and two papers to IMWUT/UbiComp 2025! 2025/03, invited to serve as the Journal Track Co-Chair for EWSN 2025 in Leuven. Please consider submitting! 2024/12, invited to serve on the TPC of ACM MobiHoc 2025 in Houston. 2024/11, RF-Diffusion received the ACM MobiCom 2024 Best Artifact Award! 2024/11, invited to serve on the TPC of ACM SenSys 2025 in Irvine. 2024/10, awarded the 2024 NAM Healthy Longevity Catalyst Awards (Hong Kong)! 2024/10, invited to serve on the TPC of ACM MobiSys 2025 in California. 2024/10, invited to serve on the TPC of IEEE DySPAN 2025 in London. 2024/09, invited to serve on the TPC of IEEE ICDCS 2025 (IoT and CPS track), Glasgow, Scotland. 2024/08, delivered my first ever lecture for middle/high school students through the HKU AI Academy for the Talented program! 2024/08, Co-Chairing The 1st International Workshop on RF Computing (RFCOM, co-located with SenSys), Hangzhou, China, 2024. 2024/06, our research on statistical acoustic sensing was funded by RGC/GRF! 2024/06, invited to serve as an Associate Editor for ACM Transactions on Internet of Things. 2024/04, co-chairing the TPC of IEEE ICPADS 2024 in Belgrade, Serbia (the first time in Europe!). Please consider submitting! 2024/04, invited to serve on the TPC of IEEE WoWMoM 2024 - PhD Forum in Perth, Western Australia. 2024/03, invited to serve on the TPC of ACM SenSys 2024 in Hangzhou. 2024/02, invited to serve on the editorial board as an Associate Editor of ACM IMWUT. About Me I'm currently an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science, The University of Hong Kong, where I lead the AIoT Lab. I was an Assistant Research Scientist in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Maryland, College Park and the Chief Scientist at Origin AI (a startup commercializing WiFi sensing technologies), working with Prof. K. J. Ray Liu, after working as a research associate in the Department of Computer Science, Princeton University and the School of Software, Tsinghua University. I received my Ph.D. degree in the Department of Computer Science and Technology, Tsinghua University, under supervision of Prof. Yunhao Liu. During my Ph.D., I was lucky to work with Prof. Mingyan Liu in the Department of EECS, University of Michigan and Prof. Jiannong Cao in the Department of Computing, HKPU. I received my B.E. degree from the School of Software, Tsinghua University. Research Interests Can machines sense without sensors? Can they "see" without cameras, in the dark, and through the walls? My research is driven by the vision of shaping "Wireless AI Perception" to advance machine intelligence beyond traditional vision. We focus on pioneering sensing AI technologies that transform "Homecare" to "Home Cares" and bring healthcare from "Benchside" to "Bedside". The field of wireless sensing has experienced tremendous growth in the past 15 years, and I'm fortunate to have my research in this area translated into award-winning products that are deployed in millions of devices worldwide. Currently, my lab is dedicated to designing cutting-edge sensing solutions as well as building commercialized applications for a smarter, more connected life. Our current research interests include: Sensing AI for Homecare, Healthcare, Eldercare Localization for Mobiles, Robots, Drones AI for Healthcare Automotive In-Cabin Sensing Research Projects Highlights on Industrial Impacts: + Our sleep monitoring work has been commercialized by Origin Wireless as Origin Health - Remote Patient Monitoring, which won the CES 2021 Best of Innovation Award! + Our works on wireless indoor tracking, gait recognition, fall detection are being commercialized by Origin Wireless Inc. Stay tuned! + Authored 60+ US/international patents and 20+ China patents. Checkout more research projects HERE, and RIM, EasiTrack, Widar, ChromaCode. RF-based Inertial Measurement Wireless, Contactless, Sensorless Sensing Hidden Screen-Camera Communication Systems Wireless Indoor Localization via Mobile Crowdsourcing Selected Publications For a complete list, see HERE or my Google Scholar Profile. According to Google Scholar, my papers have more than 5,400 citations, with an h-index of 32. Books Smart Wireless Sensing: From IoT to AIoT Zheng Yang, Kun Qian, Chenshu Wu, Yi Zhang Springer, 2021. ISBN: 978-981-16-5658-3. [Front Matter] [Read Online] Wireless Indoor Localization: A Crowdsourcing Approach Chenshu Wu, Zheng Yang, Yunhao Liu Springer, 2018. ISBN: 978-981-13-0355-5.
